page.title: 12Lore and Legend
page.content: The penance continues to the present day by descendents of the family. The gates called Redgates, so the legend tells, is where a battle took place. It was a very bloody battle where many lives were lost. The moors were running with blood where the gates are to be found. To this day the gates are always painted red. The crowning of the Rost Queen has taken place on the river in Littlebeck, a tributary of the River Esk since 1955. The Rose Queen floats down the river on a barge and is crowned in front of The Old Mill. The area around Souldgrave Farm is locally known as Hangmans Hill as this was the area where hangings took place - hence the name of the farm - Soulsgrave.
